column1: Kaiyuan (simplified Chinese: 开原; traditional Chinese: 開原; pinyin: Kāiyuán; lit.: 'Open Plains') is a county-level city in the northeast of Liaoning
column3: bordering Jilin for a small section to the north. It is under the administration of Tieling City
column4: the centre of which lies 33 kilometres (21 mi) to the southwest.

column3: and 9 townships under the city's administration.Subdistricts:

column6: Shangbadi Manchu Ethnic Township (上肥地满族乡)
column7: Xiabadi Manchu Ethnic Township (下肥地满族乡)
column8: Huangqizhai Manchu Ethnic Township (黄旗寨满族乡)
column9: Linfeng Manchu Ethnic Township (林丰满族乡)

column1: Kaiyuan is situated in northeastern Liaoning in the southeastern part of Tieling City on the eastern bank of the middle reaches of the Liao River. It borders Dongfeng County and Qingyuan Manchu Autonomous County to the east
column3: Faku and Changtu counties to the west
column4: and Lishu County (Jilin) to the north. Its administrative area reaches a maximal north-south extent of 86 km (53 mi) and east-west width of 89.4 km (55.6 mi). In the east
column5: the land begins to transition to the foothills of the Changbai Mountains
column6: while the west is marked by the Songliao Plain.

column1: Kaiyuan has a monsoon-influenced humid continental climate (Köppen Dwa)
column5: but dry winters. The four seasons here are distinctive. A majority of the annual rainfall of 661 mm (26.0 in) occurs in July and August alone. The monthly 24-hour average temperature ranges from −13.4 °C (7.9 °F) in January to 23.8 °C (74.8 °F) in July

column2: a warlord who ruled Xinjiang from 1933 to 1944.
